medium: Pen and brown ink with brown wash, over red chalk
creditline: Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund and Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund
markings:
Stamp in black ink, lower right: PM [in oval] [Lugt 3561]
Stamp in ink, on verso: AdeP. [Lugt 108a]
Stamp in ink, on verso: C.C.M. [in circle] Depass | Gift [in a larger circle] [Lugt 2014e]
Stamp in ink, on verso: AC [in square] [Lugt 88a]
inscribed: in brown ink, on book in image: EGO | VIA

makers.displaymaker: formerly attributed to José Jiménez Donoso, Spanish, ca. 1632 - 1690

texts.textentryhtml: A. Chariatte (Lugt 88a); sale, Sotheby's London, April 30, 1923, lot 17, as "Spanish School, Alonzo Cano, 17. Christ and Two Saints bistre pen and wash, and Seven others"; Parsons & Sons, London; Alfred Aaron de Pass (1861-1953), stamp (Lugt 108a) verso; gift to Cornwall County Museum, Truro, England, stamp (Lugt 2014e) verso; sale, Christie's, London, November 30, 1965, possibly part of lot 133; Mathias Polakovits, Paris and New York, stamp (Lugt 3561) recto, lower right, in black
